item.description:
UPDATE 2:
Location changed to Veggie Planet in Harvard Square.
(Land's Sake Farm's annual Strawberry Festival has been recheduled to July 1 due to rain.)

ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION:
OK supporters, let's support some real change out there! I propose that we each begin work on real-world projects to advance the application of alternative energy technologies. (I recommend you take a look at my message board post entitled Small Renewables Initiative Program for a little guidance.) Pick anything - Solar water heating for your house, a conversion of your car to run on waste vegi oil, a campaign to get a local business to install solar power or to buy Renewable Energy Credits - anything you can advance on (not necessarily finish) in a month. Even if your project turns out to be a dead end for whatever reason, you'll surely have learned something along the way. We can dedicate our next face-to-face meeting to present our projects, in whatever state they're in, and get ideas from each other. For my project, I have my sights on getting the local swim club to install solar water heating on their huge south-facing roof.

Cheers. - Josh

For more information, see http://masstech.org/G...
item.name: Boston Area Alternative Energy Supporters June Meetup
